trans-unit.source: The WS-Addressing version associated with a SOAP message or understood by an endpoint.
There are currently two version of WS-Addressing: WS-Addressing August 2004 and WS-Addressing 1.0.

These versions can be retrieved using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.WSAddressingAugust2004%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.WSAddressing10%2A> properties, respectively.
There is also an addressing version available that is not associated with WS-Addressing, which is retrieved using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.None%2A> property.
This value indicates that no version of WS-Addressing is used.
This is primarily for transports that do not pass SOAP envelopes on the wire and therefore have no use for WS-Addressing.

The addressing version is part of the message version: specifically <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion> provides the return type for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Addressing%2A> property.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> also contains the SOAP envelope version in addition to the addressing version information.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion> provides the return type for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Envelope%2A> property.
Gets the addressing version that is not associated with WS-Addressing version.

The addressing version is part of the message version: specifically <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion> provides the return type for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Addressing%2A> property.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> also contains the SOAP envelope version in addition to the addressing version information.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion> provides the return type for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Envelope%2A> property.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion"></xref> that is not associated WS-Addressing version.
Returns a string representation of the current addressing version.
A string that represents the current addressing version.
Gets an identifier for the address version associated with WS-Addressing 1.0.

The addressing version is part of the message version: specifically <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion> provides the return type for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Addressing%2A> property.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> also contains the SOAP envelope version in addition to the addressing version information.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion> provides the return type for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Envelope%2A> property.
A singleton instance that identifies the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion"></xref> that is associated with WS-Addressing 1.0.
Gets the version of WS-Addressing that is associated with WS-Addressing August 2004.

The addressing version is part of the message version: specifically <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion> provides the return type for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Addressing%2A> property.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> also contains the SOAP envelope version in addition to the addressing version information.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion> provides the return type for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Envelope%2A> property.
A singleton instance that identifies the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion"></xref> that is associated with WS-Addressing August 2004.
